definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Darling' is a term of endearment.
Now in the campus, there many intimate lovers walking around.
sentences.chinese: 现在在校园里，亲昵的情侣随处可见。

sentences.english: Explain to him that sexual intimacy is ery important to you.
sentences.chinese: 向他解释性亲昵行为对你来说是多么重要。

sentences.english: Ginny Weasley (Bonnie Wright) and Harry grow closer, even when his destiny threatens to pull them apart.
sentences.chinese: 小金妮和哈利日渐亲昵，但命运却要把两人分开。

sentences.english: Talk about your needs and how you feel when you're at that just-right level of physical closeness.
sentences.chinese: 交流下你的需求和你在恰当的肉体亲昵水平上的感受。

sentences.english: They broke the news director in the studio too intimate, non-stop kissing people can not stand.
sentences.chinese: 导演爆料两人在片场太过亲昵，不停亲嘴让人受不了。

sentences.english: Jocelyn and I made dinner, drank wine, nuzzled on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 乔斯林和我用了晚餐，喝红酒，然后在沙发上亲昵。

sentences.english: Rosie gave her an affectionate kiss on each cheek.
sentences.chinese: 罗西在她的脸蛋上每边亲昵地吻了一下。

sentences.english: I had an intimate connection with the place.
sentences.chinese: 我对这个地方有着一种亲昵感。

sentences.english: Over-sharing may also suggest a level of intimacy he is not yet ready for.
sentences.chinese: 过分分享会形成一种他并没有准备接受的亲昵关系。

definition: lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to nestle against/to snuggle up to
to caress/to fondle/to look after (tenderly)/affectionate care
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
